metadata.Title: CVE-2017-1000083 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
backend/comics/comics-document.c (aka the comic book backend) in GNOMEEvince before 3.24.1 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commandsvia a .cbt file that is a TAR archive containing a filename beginning witha "--" command-line option substring, as demonstrated by a--checkpoint-action=exec=bash at the beginning of the filename.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-1000083` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

evince - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.1
evince-common - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.1
evince-gtk - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.1
gir1.2-evince-3.0 - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.1
libevdocument3-4 - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.1
libevview3-3 - 3.18.2-1ubuntu4.1
No subscription required

atril - 1.12.2-1ubuntu0.2
atril-common - 1.12.2-1ubuntu0.2
gir1.2-atril - 1.12.2-1ubuntu0.2
libatrildocument3 - 1.12.2-1ubuntu0.2
libatrilview3 - 1.12.2-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: evince package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.18.2-1ubuntu4.1').
atril package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.12.2-1ubuntu0.2').
